title: fasteners 0.16.1 removed .acquired and thus broke datalad
body:
complained upstream https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/issues/71

spotted while observing avalanche of CI failures for https://github.com/datalad/datalad/pull/5709 which should have been green.

crashes look like this
```
======================================================================
ERROR: datalad.tests.test_archives.test_ExtractedArchive
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/tmp/dl-miniconda-1newyg4m/lib/python3.8/site-packages/datalad/support/locking.py", line 91, in lock_if_check_fails
    lgr.debug("Acquired? lock %s: %s", lock_filename, lock.acquired)
AttributeError: '_FcntlLock' object has no attribute 'acquired'
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/tmp/dl-miniconda-1newyg4m/lib/python3.8/site-packages/nose/case.py", line 198, in runTest
    self.test(*self.arg)
  File "/tmp/dl-miniconda-1newyg4m/lib/python3.8/site-packages/datalad/tests/utils.py", line 585, in _wrap_with_tree
    return t(*(arg + (d,)), **kw)
  File "/tmp/dl-miniconda-1newyg4m/lib/python3.8/site-packages/datalad/tests/test_archives.py", line 192, in test_ExtractedArchive
    extracted_ = earchive.get_extracted_file(fpath)
  File "/tmp/dl-miniconda-1newyg4m/lib/python3.8/site-packages/datalad/support/archives.py", line 427, in get_extracted_file
    self.assure_extracted()
  File "/tmp/dl-miniconda-1newyg4m/lib/python3.8/site-packages/datalad/support/archives.py", line 315, in assure_extracted
    with lock_if_check_fails(
  File "/tmp/dl-miniconda-1newyg4m/lib/python3.8/contextlib.py", line 113, in __enter__
    return next(self.gen)
  File "/tmp/dl-miniconda-1newyg4m/lib/python3.8/site-packages/datalad/support/locking.py", line 100, in lock_if_check_fails
    if lock.acquired:
AttributeError: '_FcntlLock' object has no attribute 'acquired'
```

we could have added upper bound for fasteners version, but I guess the best would be to look into removing use of `.acquired` -- will look into it now.
